file_content.text: Welcome to Tython, Padawan. Everyone at the temple is looking forward to meeting you.
You're unharmed--good. Flesh Raider shot me in the leg while I was rescuing some Padawans.
Don't know where these things got blasters, but they know how to use them.
I've been evacuated to a medcenter, but the fighting isn't over.
I'll push back the enemy, whatever it takes.
I'll stand my ground.
We need to stop them at the source.
I was expecting reinforcements by now.
Where's the Jedi Council?
Some are already here, but Flesh Raiders keep pouring in. That's why I'm calling.
I'm up to my neck in monsters, here.
Get to the point.
Another Padawan found a cave tunnel the Flesh Raiders use to enter this valley.
I need you at that tunnel, making sure the Flesh Raiders don't get any more reinforcements through it.
I'll find this cave tunnel and seal it.
Consider it closed.
Not sure what you expect me to do by myself.
Alone?
You won't be alone long. Master Orgus Din is on his way there, too.
Apparently, I'm the only competent warrior on the whole planet.
Because no one else can.
Arrogance is unbecoming of a Jedi--as are petty insults.
We need to end this conflict before anyone else gets hurt. Find the tunnel along the mountain range.
May the Force be with you.
I'm contacting the Jedi Council. Head to the training grounds. I'll join you soon.
Your former Masters praise your combat skills. They say you're becoming an expert duelist.
It's easy to excel when you're trained by the best.
I had good teachers.
Who are you?
Sorry--Derrin Weller, watchman of the training grounds. I greet new arrivals, show them around.
I've never fought anyone I couldn't beat, including my Masters.
I defeated all of them.
Impressive claim. If you're seeking fresh challenges, you'll find them.
The Jedi Council will assign you a new Master to oversee your final trials. You'll be tested in ways you can't imagine.
But when you leave Tython, you'll know what it means to be a Jedi Knight. More importantly, you'll know yourself.
I'm eager to face these trials. Where do I start?
Let's get started.
Being a Jedi Knight is my calling. What else can the Masters tell me?
I already know all that.
Many Padawans feel the same way until they face the trials. That's why releasing preconceived notions is part of the Jedi Code.
"There is no ignorance, there is knowledge." Enter your training with an open mind. You might surprise yourself.
I didn't come here to meditate and learn boring lessons.
Sounds dull.
These final trials will test your limits. Boredom is the least of your worries.
There's a speeder here that will take you--hang on. Getting an emergency signal....
--under attack, repeat, under attack! Flesh Raiders are invading the Padawan training grounds! They have blasters! Send help!
Flesh Raiders, armed with blasters? He must be mistaken.
Mistaken or not, that Padawan is under attack.
Regardless, it's trouble.
They've never come this close before....
What are these things? Animals?
Why do you say that?
You could hear the blaster fire. Go help!
Obviously not--do something!
Calm down, Padawan. Never rush into a fight before knowing your enemy.
Flesh Raiders are a species of hostile natives. They're smart enough to use tools and violent beyond reason.
I'm sending every able-bodied Jedi down to the Padawan training grounds right away--especially you.
Just point the way. I'll handle the rest.
It's an honor to help.
What makes me any better than the others?
"Especially" me? Why's that?
You've been trained for dangers like this. I know I can count on you.
You planning to stay up here and watch?
And what about you?
I'm warning the others. I'll be right behind you.
Take the speeder outside to the training grounds. Push back the Flesh Raiders--and find out if they're really using advanced weapons.
Go. I'll catch up after I alert the Jedi Council. May the Force be with you.
Welcome to Tython. Please take care in your explorations. This world is dangerous for the unprepared.
